result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carley N Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carley N Anderson appeared by video.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty appeared by video for Carley N Anderson.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  No objection from the State.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Zoom appearances approved by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carley N Anderson in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Carley N Anderson.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch  2.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carley N Anderson in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests an a Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 02.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carley N Anderson in court with attorney Alex Huppertz appear for Mark P. Powers.  Gregg Herman appeared in person, Julie Knyszek and Thomas Potter appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/13/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Oral No Contact Order with T.K.H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carley N Anderson in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/11/22 @ 1:30p
